question: 省く
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>conserve</kanji>... but why stop there when you could try <vocabulary>to omit</vocabulary> everything and <vocabulary>to eliminate</vocabulary> everything? Just take exactly what you need, conserve it, and omit everything else.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You <reading>have</reading> (<ja>はぶ</ja>) what you have, and omit what you don't need. Perfect life.
